title: OS Level 9 — Distributed & Real-Time Operating Systems
concept: Distributed OS concepts, clock synchronization, real-time scheduling and characteristics.

challenges.question: A distributed operating system primarily aims to:

options.A: Run only on a single machine
options.B: Make a collection of networked machines appear as a single coherent system

challenges.explanation: Distributed OS abstracts multiple nodes into a unified system view.

challenges.question: In distributed systems, clock synchronization protocols (like NTP) are needed because:

options.A: All machines share the same hardware clock
options.B: Different machines have independent clocks that drift over time

challenges.explanation: Each machine’s clock drifts; synchronization keeps them roughly aligned.

challenges.question: Which of the following is TRUE about a hard real-time system?

options.A: Missing a deadline occasionally is acceptable
options.B: Missing a deadline is considered a system failure

challenges.explanation: Hard real-time requires strict deadline guarantees; misses are failures.

challenges.question: A soft real-time system:

options.B: Allows occasional deadline misses but optimizes for low latency
options.D: Is the same as a batch system

challenges.explanation: Soft real-time treats deadlines as important but not absolutely strict.

challenges.question: Rate Monotonic Scheduling (RMS) assigns priorities based on:

options.C: Shortest period (highest frequency) gets highest priority

challenges.explanation: In RMS, tasks with shorter periods run more frequently and get higher priority.

challenges.question: In distributed systems, a remote procedure call (RPC) allows:

options.B: Calling a procedure on a remote machine as if it were local

challenges.explanation: RPC abstracts network communication behind a function-call interface.

challenges.question: Which is a common issue in distributed systems but not in single-machine systems?
challenges.explanation: Distributed systems must handle network partitions and partial failures where some nodes are unreachable.

challenges.question: In real-time scheduling, 'jitter' refers to:

options.B: Variation in response or completion times

challenges.explanation: Jitter is variability in timing; low jitter is desirable for predictable behavior.

challenges.question: A key design goal of real-time OS kernels is:
challenges.explanation: Real-time systems prioritize determinism and bounded latency over raw throughput.

challenges.question: In a distributed file system, client-side caching can:

options.B: Improve performance but introduce cache coherence challenges

challenges.explanation: Caching reduces latency but requires coherence policies to handle concurrent updates.
